name: @kiali/kiali-ui
homepage-comment: *Do not* change this setting if you wish run Kiali under different server root.
Instead update 'web_root' in Kaili config map in OpenShift console.
author: Red Hat
script-comments: When adding new scripts, please be careful to using `npm run` instead of `yarn` for the tasks.
Some build environments we use do not include npm access, and installing yarn is not possible.
The postinstall script exists because create-react-app does not support
using your own eslint on the build process, so we patch it.

scripts.backup-rcue: if [ ! -f node_modules/patternfly/dist/css/rcue.css.copy ]; then mv node_modules/patternfly/dist/css/rcue.css node_modules/patternfly/dist/css/rcue.css.copy; touch node_modules/patternfly/dist/css/rcue.css; fi
scripts.build: if [ "${KIALI_ENV}" = "production" ]; then npm run build:prod; else npm run build:dev; fi
scripts.build:dev: npm run remove-rcue; sh -ac 'source ./.env.upstream; npm run build:kiali'
scripts.build:kiali: npm run lint && npm run copy-fonts && npm run copy-img && npm run build-css && REACT_APP_VERSION=$npm_package_version REACT_APP_NAME=$npm_package_name REACT_APP_GIT_HASH=$(git rev-parse HEAD) react-scripts build
scripts.build:prod: npm run restore-rcue; sh -ac 'source ./.env.downstream; npm run build:kiali'
scripts.lint:precommit: if git diff --name-only HEAD | grep -E '\.tsx?$'; then npm run lint; else true; fi
scripts.remove-rcue: npm run backup-rcue ; npm run backup-rcue-additions
scripts.start: if [ "${KIALI_ENV}" = "production" ]; then npm run start:prod; else npm run start:dev; fi
scripts.start:dev: npm run remove-rcue; sh -ac 'source ./.env.upstream; npm run start:kiali'
scripts.start:kiali: npm run copy-fonts && npm run copy-img && npm run build-css && REACT_APP_VERSION=$npm_package_version REACT_APP_NAME=$npm_package_name REACT_APP_GIT_HASH=$(git rev-parse HEAD) react-scripts start
scripts.start:prod: npm run restore-rcue; sh -ac 'source ./.env.downstream; npm run start:kiali'
scripts.test: npm run build-css && TEST_RUNNER=1 react-scripts test --env=jsdom __tests__

hooks.pre-commit: yarn run pretty-quick --staged --pattern "{src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx,json,yml,css,scss},travis.yml,*.json}" && npm run lint:precommit
